subject: Creation of Corridor Management Units in PIUs-reg.

No. 248201)} Sub: Creation of Corridor Management Units in PIUs reg: As on date nearly half the length of entire NH Network is under Operation & Maintenance and is being looked by the same team of PIU which looks after the Award, Construction and allied works under the PIU. In order to effectively focus on the end to end Operation & Maintenance of Highways, it has been decided to create Corridor Management Unit (CMU) in PIU and post a dedicated Corridor Management Officer under PD. 2_ The prime objective of setting Up of Corridor Management Unit is to ensure that: (a) Operation & Maintenance of Highways are given priority under all circumstances. (b) All activities related to maintenance (verge, buildings, repairs, signages, markings, WSA), Management (traffic, tolling, Incident) and monitoring (accidents, black spots) for Roads and buildings of National Highways are effectively managed by a dedicated team. 3 It is further decided that experienced and dedicated Officers of the rank Deputy Manager  (T) (with 3+ years exp)/ Manager  (T)/DGM(T) would be designated as Corridor Management Officers (CMO) who would report to the PD of the respective PIU. Also an Officer of rank Manager (T)/DGM (T) of RO shall coordinate with all CMOs and PDs for Operation & Maintenance related works under the CMU of PIUs. 4 Roles & Responsibilities The broad  responsibilities of CMOs will be as under (refer Appendix-A for details): (a) Highway Operations & 'Maintenance Drone Analytics, NSV , FWD, MBIU and other emerging technologies, user feedback review and complaint management. (b) Toll Operations- ATMS, ATCC, WIM; Fastag System and other ITS works (c) Road Safety Audits- local liaison, DSRC meetings, rectification of accident spots, blackspots, removal of encroachments (d) Incident Management (e) O&M Contract Administration and Documentation (f) Assistance for Highway Administration (WSA, Retail Outlets, OFC, Access Permission etc.) (g) Management updation of Datalake and other portals in respect of O&M of Highways.
